channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15135] Add metrics for storefile age
item.description:
In order to make sure that compactions are fully up to date it would be nice to have metrics on:

  • Max storefile age
  • Min storefile age
  • Average storefile age
  • Number of reference files

If we could have those metrics per region and per regionserver it would be awesome.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: tested on local cluster while running 'hbase pe'

-1 overall

Hmm.. So findbug claims that –

org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.RpcServer$Connection.close() might ignore java.lang.Exception
Bug type DE_MIGHT_IGNORE (click for details)
In class org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.RpcServer$Connection
In method org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.RpcServer$Connection.close()
Exception class java.lang.Exception
At RpcServer.java:[line 1920]
At RpcServer.java:[line 1920]

And I haven't touched this file.

It says -

./hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/regionserver/MetricsRegionServerWrapperImpl.java:602:5: error: Method length is 174 lines (max allowed is 150).

and it's line is 14 chars long.

2 out of 3 tests are passing for me, TestStoreFileInfo is genuine, will fix in next patch.
Fixed broken tests, added call to (h)store to read number of HFiles under store, make avg age not include non-hfiles storefiles in stores.

Ok this is kind of weird. The build is passing on my local. When I look at https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/307/console I see:

============================================================================
============================================================================
Patch maven install
============================================================================
============================================================================

cd /testptch/hbase/hbase-hadoop2-compat
mvn -Dmaven.repo.local=/home/jenkins/yetus-m2/hbase-master-0 -DHBasePatchProcess -fae clean install -DskipTests=true -Dmaven.javadoc.skip=true > /testptch/patchprocess/patch-mvninstall-hbase-hadoop2-compat.txt 2>&1
Elapsed: 0m 12s
cd /testptch/hbase/hbase-hadoop-compat
mvn -Dmaven.repo.local=/home/jenkins/yetus-m2/hbase-master-0 -DHBasePatchProcess -fae clean install -DskipTests=true -Dmaven.javadoc.skip=true > /testptch/patchprocess/patch-mvninstall-hbase-hadoop-compat.txt 2>&1
Elapsed: 0m 10s

So hbase-hadoop2-compat is now getting built before hbase-hadoop-compat, though hbase-hadoop2-compat pom says it depends on hbase-hadoop-compat?

Hmm.. Sean Busbey do you have any insight by chance?

And, sure enough, it fails then

hbase-hadoop2-compat in the patch failed.
that seems to be the reason for failed tests too.
The build error for module ordering is YETUS-280. you can build with this change in place if you go to the precommit job and use "build with parameters" to check the USE_YETUS_PRERELEASE option.

and the findbugs complaint says that it's for pre-existing issues on the changed module, not for the current patch.

the section on the patch says:

+1 findbugs 3m 6s the patch passed

disabling the -1 for pre-existing issues is already filed as HBASE-15151
Thanks Sean Busbey! That puzzled me... Let me try with USE_YETUS_PRERELEASE set on.

-1 overall

Sean Busbey hmm.. could it be that the patch gets stuck somehow and can't be run, even if renamed? I try to restart the patch manually but it fails immediately.
[EnvInject] - Variables injected successfully.
[PreCommit-HBASE-Build] $ /bin/bash -e /tmp/hudson920775254521547136.sh
[WARN] patch process already existed '/home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/patchprocess'
% Total % Received % Xferd Average Speed Time Time Time Current
Dload Upload Total Spent Left Speed
0 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 :: :: :: 0
100 168 0 168 0 0 450 0 :: :: :: 451
tar: This does not look like a tar archive

If you're manually running the precommit job, then you should be able to rerun it without a rename (the duplicate submission check is done by the admin job, not the individual precommit jobs).

the "not a tar archive" error looks like an error with downloading some tool; probably a redirect not getting followed. lemme see if it's something simple I can fix now.

It's this section:


    ## from github

    curl -L https://api.github.com/repos/apache/yetus/tarball/HEAD > yetus.tar.gz

    tar xvpf yetus.tar.gz

it must have been the github outage yesterday. looks like curl won't fail on HTTP 4xx or 5xx unless we tell it to via --fail. I'll update the job to do this.

I see.. thanks for looking into it!

I was suspecting this "patch process already existed" as indication of prohibited resubmission, but was able to get it through after 2 or 3 attempts. Looks like sporadic failure. Given that issue with incorrect (or non-deterministic) module reordering, does it make sense to turn this flag on by default for HBase pre-commit jobs?
IMHO no; we should not be relying on a pre-release version of another project. most patches still don't cross module boundaries and the next yetus release should be soon.
Yeah.. Agree.
+1 commit to the world.
Committed v4.1 to master (added additional oneliner check for minTempStoreFileAge on commit, just FYI, tested on local cluster)

-1 overall



Vote Subsystem Runtime Comment
-1 patch 0m 5s HBASE-15135 does not apply to master. Rebase required? Wrong Branch? See https://yetus.apache.org/documentation/latest/precommit-patchnames for help.
